tripreview.Title: "A small getaway from reality"
tripreview.sentence: I just stumbled there, the keeper was very kind to offer explanations and background.

tripreview.Title: "Good mood cafe."
tripreview.sentence: good mood, kind serving.
clean food.
sandwich is very delicious.
but little bit expensive to me.
no wifi.

tripreview.Title: "Good quality cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Really liked this cafe, menu was good and service excellent.
Next time in Fort Kochi I will make a point of returning here.

tripreview.Title: "Cool place to go."
tripreview.sentence: Cool is the word for this place.
Very artistic atmosphere and romantic.
Elegant with nice food.
Drinks, although they are cool also, are not so nice.

tripreview.Title: "Consistently Amazing"
tripreview.sentence: I have visited Kashi many times with friends over the years.
Each time it has been an amazing experience.
Thanks !

tripreview.Title: "Enjoy Food amongst Artefacts."
tripreview.sentence: A very nice art gallery restaurant taking full advantage of the nature, well maintained end served.
Good food and service.

tripreview.Title: "A very inviting spot"
tripreview.sentence: When staying in Fort Kochin in August, this friendly, interesting cafe became our regular breakfast spot, where we often lingered til late morning, enjoying its cool, blend of indoor and outdoor spaces and its eclectic collection of local artefacts - as unpretentious and refreshing as its delicious fresh food - wonderful fruit granolas, omelettes, sundaes and much else.
The informal atmosphere lends itself to easy chats with fellow travellers.

tripreview.Title: "MUST VISIT"
tripreview.sentence: Small, neat, AWESOME place tucked in the lanes.
Absolute delight to be there.
Read about it here on tripadvisor only.
Took us a while to find it from fort kochi.
It is a cafe cum art gallery.
Well not exactly a full fledged art gallery, but when we went there, there were photographs done by a local photographer on display.
Inside there are a few art installations.
The place is small, cozy, and can accommodate a good number of people.
We had coffee, herbal tea and the chocolate cake with the most delicious choclate/toffee syrup, which was absolute to-die-for.
we ordered 2 of them.
the tea was awesome.
They had infused it with ginger and some other herbs and it was something to relish, specially when it was raining outside.

tripreview.Title: "Must go place for art, coffee , cake and yousrself"
tripreview.sentence: I have already recommended this place.
Been a regular visiter since the time they started as living in Cochin, this is a place of recluse for me.
A soulful experience admist excellentcoffee, art and home baked cakes with ever smiling and warm staff who makes you feel @ home.
Sometimes it can get crowded but yeahhh thats how business grows:))) Still my favourite place so far and take all my friends and guests there .
A great place to spent 'me time' too.

tripreview.Title: "Good food good environment"
tripreview.sentence: Good food good environment--- do try the crab cake which was delicious and mouth watering.
There are other dishes also equally good.

tripreview.Title: "Art + cafe fusion.. !! Loved it.."
tripreview.sentence: one of the most sought after cafe and love the theme and the menu.
Must have is the Chocolate cake and hot chocolate syrup.
1 piece of the cake and your filled.
while you place you order, walk around the place and be refreshed .
love the ambiance!

tripreview.Title: "Great Ambience"
tripreview.sentence: A good art cafe in fort kochi.
It has a great ambiance,interesting interior.
The chocolate cake with chocolate sauce is the yummy,its huge enough portion for two persons.
Its crowded especially in the evenings.
A bit pricey but worth it.

tripreview.Title: "Great Food Location"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice feel about this place great food and service .
I Had the seafood salad and my wife the watermelon and feta very nice coffee recommended chi?
lout spot.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting....cafe+art gallery"
tripreview.sentence: The red terracotta flooring blends well with the inventive 'wall' garden and has a cool mix of seating.
Interesting art pieces dot the space
from prints to avant garde sculptures.

tripreview.Title: "Sit, relax and unwind on weekends"
tripreview.sentence: Had heard a lot about this place and visited it recently with my husband.
On entering you will see the art display and go further in to find a beautiful place with nice seating arrangements.
The whole place has a nice feel to it.
Now, talking about the food; they provide only snack options.
Their cakes are really nice, we tried a slice each of carrot cake and chocolate cake.
Bot were big chunky pieces and were yummy.
We also ordered a cup of hot chocolate and a ginger tea pot.
The tea pot has enough in it for 4 persons to drink.

So I would suggest you to stick to just one beverage "pot" Will not say that it has a wow factor but keeping in mind that Kochi does not have such places to hangout I would suggest that you visit the place for a quiet time with someone special.
P.S-the place gets crowded during the evening, so select a convenient time and avoid rush hours.

tripreview.Title: "Herrliche Oase im indischen Trubel"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice Cafe with good Art and very good food - I wish we could find more places like that in India!

tripreview.Title: "New Idea coffee and art"
tripreview.sentence: Its an art studio including coffee shop.
You can enjoy the taste of both Art and food.
But don't expect lot of art items inside the gallery.

tripreview.Title: "Chocolate cake that is too die for"
tripreview.sentence: The food price here is quite high comparing to other places but totally worth it.
Friendly and attentive service despite many customers.
Nice art collection as well.
PS.
I highly recommend Chocolate Cake.
It is so good!

tripreview.Title: "Kashi art gallery"
tripreview.sentence: The art here is truly inspiring.
Every wall, pillar and corner is covered by interesting works of art?
sculptures, paintings, carvings and local craft.
A must visit when u are in Fortcochin , Kerala.
Such an amazing cafe this is!
It's a place that brings together tea and art.
Kashi was quite a popular hang out for the people at my college.
Its quaint, quiet and cheap!
We ve spent hours there chatting, playing games at times.
No one would ever bother us either.
And it was always cold coffee with lots of sugar syrup and milk and chocolate cake with chocolate sauce.

tripreview.Title: "Cafe with Nice Art Theme"
tripreview.sentence: First thing to mention is the wait time to receive the order.
But you will find food served is worth the wait.
Interiors are nicely done with many arts with wood and iron are displayed.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting"
tripreview.sentence: Interesting gallery to visit although it is part of cultural and authentic type of gallery will gives some experience about a snoper hub way.

tripreview.Title: "lovely!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: We were guided to this place by Mr.Manoj of Ayurville, It was a lovely place and the aromas of chocolate cakes made me so eager to order one, and must say that it was the best choc cake ever eaten.
We ordered for pizzas and sandwiches as well which were awsum.
The decor is kept quite nice more like an open garden and art all around which gives you the feel of A Portugeuse or French colony.
Overall a very nice place to hangout and sip into the best cold coffees in town!

tripreview.Title: "A place to hangout with art"
tripreview.sentence: A place where fine art and finest food goes hand in hand.
A cafe which is also an art gallery, this is one of the best hangout places in the town.
take your soulful of art before you immerse yourself in some of the finest delicacies they offer, the cakes of offer never failing to sweep me off my feet.
if you are in fort kochi, a visit to kashi is a must.

tripreview.Title: "Kashi gallery"
tripreview.sentence: I went for breakfast.
its wonderful.
location near Chinese fishing net.
Ambience and food quality too good.
Must try french toast.

tripreview.Title: "Gret place to meet"
tripreview.sentence: This was the rendezvous to meet a friend we had not seen for years.
We chose the have coffee, watermelon with feta cheese and orange cakes.
The coffee was from freshly ground beans and smelt and tasted good.
The orange cakes were delicious and the water melon,cheese and walnuts harmonized well.

tripreview.Title: "The Art Cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Good going around with innovative and excellent art forms and a Cafe with solitude.
A good place to be in.

tripreview.Title: "good"
tripreview.sentence: same menu for last 2 years.
very less options for veg.
service is good , what ever they serve is good.

tripreview.Title: "This is the only Cafe worth its name in Fort Cochin"
"The refreshing lime, ginger and honey drink is a must"
tripreview.sentence: Kashi is a good place for snacks, refreshing drinks and if for a change you want a non-Indian meal.
Whilst I loved eating the local Indian food, I occasionally wanted a change.
My favourites were the roast chicken, the lime ginger and honey drink and the ginger and lime tea with honey.
The staff are great as well.

tripreview.Title: "ALLWAYS CONSTANTLY GOOD FOOD AND FRIENDLY SERVICE A LITTLE OASIS"
tripreview.sentence: We go to Fort Kochi and especially Kashi very often as the food is constantly good and the staff make us feel like old friends .
highly recommend will return again and again .

tripreview.Title: "Great Cafe"
tripreview.sentence: maazing art cafe.
The abience is rejuvinating.
Everything on menu is great.

tripreview.Title: "Go for the food not the art"
tripreview.sentence: Heard a lot about this place before I went there.
Not too many art pieces or installations even during the biennale.
Really small and little uncomfortable seats and the place gets hot during summer.
Food is nice but expensive and great ambience.

tripreview.Title: "Artistic place with creative and colorful breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: I love this place; if you like English breakfast this is the place for you.
Breakfast is really filing so please don't end up ordering too much.
Spinach cheese omelette is amazing.
You will fall in love with brown breads they serve.
Yum it is.
It is such a great experience to sit and have your meal here as the place has very different energy, it is full of art pieces and open air so natural sunlight makes it more lively.

tripreview.Title: "The breakfast is to die for!"
tripreview.sentence: I loved the ambiance and the food.
The art was stunning.
Would suggest they keep one or two options for eggless desserts too or else the experience remains slightly incomplete for vegans and those allergic to eggs.
For everything else I strongly recommend a few visits while you are in town.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing Place in Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Loved the choco cake and soaked in the ambience.
Wish they had served the chocolate sauce separately and not poured it all over the cake and made it gooey !

tripreview.Title: "Nothing there"
tripreview.sentence: We went there to see Binnale installation but there was nothing to see.
It is not an art gallery.
It is just two rooms.

tripreview.Title: "Good place to relax"
tripreview.sentence: Its a cafe with an ard gallery.
Its close to most of the attractions of Fort Kochi like St Fransic church,Kochi beach,Chinese fishing net,Santa cruz basilica etc.
We visited here during our visit of fort Kochi to relax for some time.
We ordered a coffee with a mushroom omlet and a sandwich.
Every thing was perfectly cooked.
If you are in fort kochi and serching for a place to relax and chill and have some snack then its the place.

tripreview.Title: "Great Ambience spoilt by poor service"
tripreview.sentence: Its a lovely place to relax in Fort Kochi.
Its a beautiful art cafe with great ambiance.
However if you are not a firang(foreigner), dont expect anything called service.
Staff are downright rude.
If this one aspect can be looked into this place will surely get 5 stars!

tripreview.Title: "Good place to have breakfast in fort kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place to relax and have great food.
The Ambience is good and is located in a clean place in fort kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Rustic, Arty place with great food!"
tripreview.sentence: Most art cafes either serve art or food.
This one is an exception.
The great art was very well complemented by awesome food.
Their breakfast and pastas are both equally good.
and the chefs are professional so you dont get dhaba food.
the setting is also great
several installation art pieces, fusion work, skull tiles on the floor and great seating.
very international in setting and food.
completely floored!

tripreview.Title: "Old charm of Kashi.....Gone"
tripreview.sentence: We all love the old Kashi,now everything is changed
ownership,staff,menu,price and even the peaceful ambiance is gone.
Any way there are people who love that kind of place.

tripreview.Title: "art-y food"
tripreview.sentence: ambience was great.
there is always some exhibition on.
the sea food is good.
their ginger lemon drink is divine.

tripreview.Title: "Exceptional place for good food"
tripreview.sentence: go for food and ambience, art is minimal.

tripreview.Title: "Wonderful food"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place for eating and relaxing at all times of the day.
the menu has many different types of dishes and teas.

tripreview.Title: "KASHI"
tripreview.sentence: Good to Visit, not much to each for vegetarians, however, the presentation is certainly wonderful, be it food or art.

tripreview.Title: "Good"
tripreview.sentence: Love the ambience.
so different !
It looks good with all the paintings.
Cakes are the best.
One of the best place to hang out with friends.

tripreview.Title: "Bucket List Place"
tripreview.sentence: The place is located in the streets of the Kochi and you will see a lot of Graffiti on the walls on the way.
The building is very old style, maybe Portugese or Dutch architecture not sure.
Once you enter you see a large hall where there are tablets in place to go through the art.
Once you enter the other room you are filled with that wonderful smell of bakery.
The sugar, the wheat and the milk baking some where.
The seats are the unusual ones with all type of shapes but comfortable.
The Iced tea and the cakes are out of this world.
Other than that you get normal food which tastes good.
Please do visit this place with time in your hand.
It is not a place to be hurried on.
I think there are artists too who live there.
Truly a different and unique dinning experience.

tripreview.Title: "Good to pass by"
tripreview.sentence: Not so great.
If there is leisure and good company, it can be visited.
I had such time and friend to pass my free time there.
The area within the boundary was very clean.

tripreview.Title: "Art and Food!!"
tripreview.sentence: We landed here while roaming the streets, it is an interesting place with some art .
Coffee and sandwiches were decent but I guess a lil over hyped.
Can be visited once for the ambience.

tripreview.Title: "A must go place "
tripreview.sentence: It's a place for people who are in search for a fine place, people who love art and coffee.
The architecture, Nature, and the tradition of Cochin blend together like the best coffee in the world.

tripreview.Title: "An exceptional art gallery"
tripreview.sentence: Kashi Art Gallery facilitates the communication between art, artists, and its spectators.
The Gallery has been built and preserved by people zealous about the arts with the aim of supporting artists to grow up and distinguished names are associated with the gallery.
The gallery supports art of all geneses and the gallery provides working space and accommodation to research in their skills.
The gallery has thus created a platform for artists to exchange ideas.
The Gallery has a cafe which serves authentic cuisines and the cafe is also a joint for the artists and visitors to have discussions enjoying the food.
The art gallery conducts exhibitions of noted artists and is now getting more attention because of the success of the Kochi-Muziris Biennale.
I found the concept of Kashi Art Gallery quiet unique and this will attract lot of visitors for sure.

tripreview.Title: "arty place"
tripreview.sentence: the place has a gud ambience.
the menu is not expansive
and the fud is not expensive either.
expect light meals like cheese omellette, english breakfast items and chiocolate cake to fill your belly.
Oh and their ice tea

tripreview.Title: "fusion of Art and Food"
tripreview.sentence: This place displays work of various artists which you can browse while waiting for your food.
It's a classy place.
Food is similar to what you would get at a high end restaurant.

tripreview.Title: "Nice cafe with the feel of traditional Kochi architecture"
tripreview.sentence: Located in the Fort Kochi area, Kashi Art cafe seems to be the best-rated Tripadvisor attraction in Kochi.
We went there purely because of this.
It is a good cafe with seemingly some history associated.
You can visit it if you are in Fort Kochi.
However, there are multiple other cafes in that area which you may want to explore.

tripreview.Title: "I never leave ernakulam without visiting Kashi in Fort Kochi."
tripreview.sentence: Love the artsy ambience!
beyond words, It has ar art gallery with art exhibitions and events happening very often by great famous artists.
The Food is great!
The best thing about Kashi is that you can sit there for hourse with your friends for anylong, the staff would never hurry you to clear the place.
and you just enjoy being there.
I even enjoy the water melon slices that they give in the salad for the way the slice it.
They have great tasting cold coffee in their menu.
no one should miss it.

tripreview.Title: "Coffee and Art! What more...."
tripreview.sentence: Simple the best place in fort Kochi to stop over for a coffee and muse at the art gallery.
The gallery is frequently updated.
However, Keep in mind they close early: At 7:00 PM.

tripreview.Title: "One of my favourite places. "
tripreview.sentence: I go to kashi, whenever I have a chance to go to fortkochi.
It's a decent place.
Love to have my brunch from there.
Spinach mushroom cheese omelet and pie are my favourites.
The fruit juices are served neat.
Chocolate cake is delicious.

tripreview.Title: "You get the best Chocolate Cake"
tripreview.sentence: Ideal place to spend some time while in Fort Cochin to enjoy the ambiance.
Their Chocolate Cake is a super hit and my daughter who lives in Chennai, dont miss it every time she is in Cochin.

tripreview.Title: "Calm oasis off a hot street"
tripreview.sentence: As you enter the shady cafe with several small rooms you are met with quirky art pieces.
Nice area for sitting and having a cold drink with friends.
Food menu limited but what they had was good and we did go back on a further day of our travels.
The granola and yoghurt dessert is lovely and a meal in itself !

tripreview.Title: "Glad we found this little gem of a gallery and cafe"
tripreview.sentence: We were searching for the art work by Riyas Komu 'Gandhi from Kochi' and stumbled across the gallery almost by accident which was selling prints.
A great space has been created here with a lovely courtyard cafe serving good food.

tripreview.Title: "contemporary dining"
tripreview.sentence: egg and bacon sandwich a good pick, a good place for art lovers and food mongers equally.
i loved the entire layout of the place.

tripreview.Title: "stop by"
tripreview.sentence: Had heard of this place and stopped by for a coffee.
Interesting place, decor.
The sandwich wasn't great but had a good time looking around and hanging with friends.

tripreview.Title: "Where Art meets the Heart"
tripreview.sentence: Kashi is truly one of the major attractions of Fort Kochin.
There's not a single time that I have been here without visiting Kashi.
Their cakes are yummy and the ambience there is tooo good to be true.
The crowd is mainly tourists, and like them, its a good place to settle down with your books.

tripreview.Title: "One of the Best Places in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: This place was recommended by our guy for this trip.
I wish I could take this place with me and drop it down the street from where I live.
I would visit every day.
The food is soooooooo good.
I mean great.
Especially their cakes they make every day.
My friend and I had lemon and our other 2 had chocolate.
Sampled both and that along with the brunch food we had we stuffed ourselves to capacity.
I want to visit this place every single day!

tripreview.Title: "Nice cafe with some artwork."
tripreview.sentence: This was recommended to us and we lunched there a few times as it had very good food, a pleasant ambience and was restful.
Take a tuctuc as the art cafe is on a narrow alley and you are unlikely to just stubble across it.
A cool courtyard makes a pleasant retreat from the hustle and humidity.
Lovely bread for the choice of sandwiches, large slices of chocolate or lemon cake not to be missed.
The artwork consists of a few sculptures and paintings dotted around the courtyard.
Pleasant cafe service in a calm, restful setting.

tripreview.Title: "Absolutely LOVE this place!"
tripreview.sentence: The vibe, the art, the staff, the food, the coffee
everything is perfect.
Super chill place and opens early (8:30am) for breakfast.
The portion sizes are perfect, everything is decently priced, the coffee is seriously really good and everything is super fresh.
The art on display is gorgeous and the Spanish and Indian music playing in the background puts you at ease.
Staff are cool about guests sitting around for a while and are happy to help with planning any sightseeing in the area or arranging cabs.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting art gallery cum cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Not very much art on display, but a couple of interesting pieces.
I come here for the food and coffee.

tripreview.Title: "Good ambience, amazing food!!"
tripreview.sentence: We had heard a lot about the place, so me and my wife decided to give a try and dropped in one afternoon.
The place, being quite close to the park, was pretty easy to locate.
The lone window and door facing the narrow alley, just like many other "hole in the wall" places in Fort Kochi, did not surprise us.
From the alley, you step into a medium sized hall, where I guess most of the exhibitions hosted by the house take place.
When we arrived, there was some art installation work going on, and so we moved ahead as there was pretty much nothing for us to admire.
Walking on, we passed a counter on the right, where it seems the coffee is ground and the beverages are done.
From there you step out to a tiny courtyard that reminds you of the "nadumuttam" in traditional Keralite houses.
There is an art installation right in the middle of the space, and few paintings decorate the walls.
Some concrete tables and seating arrangements are made there, which are by no means uncomfortable as they look.
You continue further, and the space bottlenecks to a corridor, where they have arranged the kitchen on the right side.
Here also there is a thought provoking installation on the left wall.
There is also a staircase, which is private it seems, that adds to the overall ambiance.
Then again the space widens and there are few tables arranged, and there are few good paintings on the walls, and few remarkable installations.
They have arranged tables for groups, couples, and even for those avid reading buffs who love to ponder over their favorite read over a cup of coffee or two.
There is a classic touch to the overall arrangement, the furniture, the art work, and the best part is that they have made an aesthetically appealing use of natural light.
The calm and the quiet that the place offers is quite soothing.
Even the hand-wash area had a classic touch to it.
We settled down in the courtyard on one of the few concrete seating arrangements, as most of the seats in the other space were taken.
The service was so prompt that as soon as we were seated a cheerful guy passed on the menu to us.

After a taxing brainstorming session over the limited menu, we landed upon our order of a Chicken Salad Sandwich, a Tomato Cheese Omelet with Brown bread toast, a Lemon iced tea, and the acclaimed Chocolate cake with Chocolate sauce.
The dishes were served pretty quick, the food was very good on a total, and was presented quite well.
The bread was good, and the chicken salad filling was very well done too.
The cheese omelet and toast came with 2 generous pieces of watermelon and that was a pleasant twist from the usual stuff.
But I felt like too much tomato and rather big pieces too.
Could be a personal thing.
But the Chocolate cake was a class apart.
It was simply superb.
For me it felt like something that would get you indulged, and make you feel lost.
No wonder why we could see many guests helping themselves with decent portions of the same.
Having said that, we felt that the portion was a tad too much for one person.
To summarize, good place, great food, nice ambience, prompt service and few pieces of good artwork if you are an admirer.
If you are in a mood to read a book, sipping your coffee, nibbling on something, or if you want to have a nice little chat with your friends over some good food, this is a place worth considering.
